intro: Mikania phaeoclados, commonly known as the dark-leaved Mikania, is a flowering plant belonging to the Asteraceae family. It is native to Central and South America, where it thrives in tropical and subtropical regions. The plant is characterized by its slender, climbing stems and small, heart-shaped leaves that are typically dark green in color. Its flowers are inconspicuous, consisting of tubular florets that are usually yellow or greenish in hue. Mikania phaeoclados is often found in disturbed habitats such as roadsides and forest edges, where it can spread rapidly due to its vigorous growth habit.
